concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: DTD: Coding requirements for specialization modules
concept.shortdesc: To be extensible and backward compatible, DITA requires that a DTD implementation of structural and domain specialization modules conform to well-defined implementation (coding) requirements.

conbody.p: These coding requirements implement the specialization architecture with the capabilities and within the limitations of the DTD grammar. They are the coding requirements for structural specializations, element domain specializations, and attribute domain specializations.

link.desc: The base DITA element and attribute types may be extended through the creation of new vocabulary modules that define specializations of more-general types.

link.linktext: DTD: Coding requirements for element type declarations
link.desc: This topic covers general coding requirements for both structural and element-domain vocabulary modules.

link.linktext: DTD: Coding requirements for structural modules
link.desc: A structural vocabulary module defines a new topic or map type as a specialization of a base topic or map type. The purpose is usually to enhance the user's interaction by adapting the topic or map type to its particular purposes.

link.linktext: DTD: Coding requirements for topic type modules
link.desc: The vocabulary modules that define topic types have an additional coding requirement. They need to define whether topics are permitted to nest and what topic types are permitted to nest. These rules for topic nesting are specified by a parameter entity.

link.linktext: DTD: Coding requirements for element domain modules
link.desc: The vocabulary modules that define element domains have an additional coding requirement. The entity declaration (.ent) file must include a a parameter entity for each element that is extended by the domain.

link.linktext: DTD: Coding requirements for attribute domain modules
link.desc: The vocabulary modules that define attribute domains have additional coding requirements. The entity declaration (.ent) file must include a parameter entity for the new attribute, which can be referenced in document type shells, as well as a text entity that specifies the contribution to the domains attribute for the attribute domain.
